head.title: Treat Cocaine for What It Is

hedline.hl1: Treat Cocaine for What It Is

block.p: Re ''Cocaine, Hidden in Plain Sight'' by Melena Ryzik (June 10):

The writer, as well as the clinical experts and club denizens she quotes, all miss a glaring truth about cocaine abuse. The legal system turns a blind eye to casual cocaine use because the users are part of an upscale, largely white, largely young population of social climbers. Crack users are perceived to be a largely poor, largely minority population with no social mobility.
Re ''Cocaine, Hidden in Plain Sight'' by Melena Ryzik (June 10):

The writer, as well as the clinical experts and club denizens she quotes, all miss a glaring truth about cocaine abuse. The legal system turns a blind eye to casual cocaine use because the users are part of an upscale, largely white, largely young population of social climbers. Crack users are perceived to be a largely poor, largely minority population with no social mobility.

Crack and cocaine are both identically pernicious drugs, and the legal system needs to either come down on both equally or decriminalize both equally, unless we want to continue to live in this corner of ''Two Americas.''
